principle.name: Atomic Commits
principle.description: Each commit should represent a single logical change.
principle.rationale: This makes history easier to understand and revert.

example.good: Separate commits for refactor and bugfix
example.bad: Mixing unrelated changes in one commit

principle.name: Conventional Commit Messages
principle.description: Follow a standard format (e.g., Conventional Commits) for messages.

principle.name: Gratitude Suffix
principle.description: Always end every commit message with "الحمد لله". For multiline commit messages, append it at the end of the entire message.
principle.rationale: Expresses gratitude and maintains consistency in commit history.

example.good: fix: resolve crash on startup الحمد لله

feat: add login flow
- add UI - connect API الحمد لله
example.bad:
feat: add login flow
- add UI - connect API

convention.rule: Use imperative mood and concise language in commit messages. Always end with "الحمد لله".

examples.good: fix: resolve crash on startup الحمد لله

pitfall.why_problematic: Pollutes history and may expose sensitive data.
Misses the required standard for all commit messages.
pitfall.correct_approach: Always append "الحمد لله" at the end of the commit message.

category.name: before_commit
category.item: Review staged changes with git diff
Check commit message for clarity, standards, and gratitude suffix
Ensure no secrets or large files are staged
